alert.note: Alert for Mississippi; Scott (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 30 at 4:13PM CDT until March 30 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Pulaski County in southern Illinois... Alexander County in southern Illinois... Fulton County in western Kentucky... Northwestern Hickman County in western Kentucky... Carlisle County in western Kentucky... Ballard County in western Kentucky... Mississippi County in southeastern Missouri... Eastern Scott County in southeastern Missouri... * Until 500 PM CDT. * At 413 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Benton to near Big Oak Tree State Park to near Reelfoot Lake State Park, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Scott City, Anniston, Olive Branch and Horseshoe Lake Conservation Area around 420 PM CDT. Charleston around 425 PM CDT. Hickman, Tamms and Wyatt around 430 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Cairo, Wickliffe, Big Oak Tree State Park, Dorena, Mounds, Barlow, Mound City, La Center, Bardwell, Karnak and Lovelaceville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 1 and 21. Interstate 57 in Missouri between Mile Markers 3 and 21. Interstate 55 between Mile Markers 75 and 83. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southern Illinois...western Kentucky...and southeastern Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
